title: Japan Calls for Tough Response on Ukraine, Saying China Is Watching
sub_head: ‘We have to be very solid’ against using force to change the status quo, Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi says in interview
body:
TOKYO—Japan said democratic nations should take a tough line if Russia invades Ukraine, because a failure to do so would embolden others, such as China, that want to exert control over their neighbors.
“If something happens on the Ukraine border, that outcome might affect other people’s calculations in Asia,” Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi said in an interview. “We have to be very solid on this issue.”
